definition: to make sth of oneself/to become a person who is worthy of respect
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a self-made genius
spare the rod and spoil the child (idiom)

sentences.english: Be deep rooted , flourishing and growing quickly.
We have to base itself, potential, and strengthen the goal, and strive to become.
sentences.chinese: 我們要立足自身，挖掘潛力，強化目標，力求成才。

sentences.english: I learn English all by myself.
sentences.chinese: 我的英語是自學成才的。

sentences.english: Many young musicians in Iraq are self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克很多年輕音樂家都是自學成才的。

sentences.english: "Four selfs" education is the base of promoting them to grow healthily.
sentences.chinese: 四自“教育是促進女大學生健康成長與成才的基礎。

sentences.english: To spare the rod was, traditionally, to spoil the child.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上認爲，孩子不打不成才。

sentences.english: Man is a born baby, his power is the power of growth.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都是新生的嬰兒，他的力量來自成才的力量。

sentences.english: Ms.Hou dined on plenty of bitterness in working her way up to champion.
sentences.chinese: 在冠軍成才路上，侯逸凡同樣吃了很多苦。

sentences.english: The minimum identification rate can be calculated from the success rate. 4.
sentences.chinese: 選材成功率的極小值可以從成才率反推。

sentences.english: His success can't be separated from the nurture and edification of Yimeng Culture.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮的成才離不開沂蒙文化對他的哺育與薰陶。

sentences.english: J. V. : There are very few self-educated pianists.
sentences.chinese: 自學成才的鋼琴家是很少的。

sentences.english: All times and in all, many great people are relying on self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 古今中外，許多偉人都是靠自學成才的。

sentences.english: I understand you've learned a lot by yourself.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道你這傢伙厲害，自學成才啊。

sentences.english: If compare up to heaven, self-study is the ladder of success.
sentences.chinese: 如果把成才比作登天，自學便是成才的天梯。

sentences.english: If compare up to heaven, self-study is the ladder of success.
sentences.chinese: 如果把成才比作登天，自學便是成才的天梯。

sentences.english: Parents would not expect their children to become useful persons without working hard.
sentences.chinese: 父母們不能指望孩子們不經過刻苦努力就可以成才。

definition: to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
to make sth of oneself/to become a person who is worthy of respect/(of a tree) to grow to full size/to become useful for timber
to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
ridgepole/ridgepole and beams/person able to bear heavy responsibility/mainstay (of organization)/pillar (of state)
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom). A good education program takes a long time to develop.
pinyin: shi2 nian2 shu4 mu4 , bai3 nian2 shu4 ren2

definition: to educate people (esp. morally)
to study hard/assiduous
to be successful in one's studies/academic success
to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
diligent/assiduous
to teach by words and example (idiom)
assiduous/taking great pains
to make sth of oneself/to become a person who is worthy of respect
to mature/to grow/growth
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
(idiom) to teach in line with the student's ability
